Tožilstvo za Matića predlaga 30 let zapora
07 Nov 2019, 15:17 by Danijel Cek

“Dejanje je storil iz čiste koristoljubnosti, maščevanja in sovraštva do pokojnih. Zato predlagam, da ga sodišče spozna za krivega in za vsak umor izreče 25 let zaporne kazni, torej enotno kazen 30 let,” je pred slabo uro dejala koprska tožilka Anja Štrovs in sodniku Julijanu Glavini predlagala, da obtoženega za lanski dvojni umor v Krkavčah Marka Matića spozna za krivega. Matićev odvetnik Branko Gvozdić pa trdi, da ni šlo za načrtovan umor, ampak kvečjemu za silobran ali uboj na mah.



Koprska tožilka Anja Štrovs je sodniku Julijanu Glavini predlagala, da obtoženega za lanski dvojni umor v Krkavčah Marka Matića spozna za krivega in ga obsodi na 30 let zapora. Foto: Zdravko Primožič/FPA

KOPER > Tožilka namreč trdi, da Matićev zagovor o tem, da naj bi ga pokojna polsestra Milka Grbac in njen mož Angel prva napadla, ne zdrži resne presoje. In tudi če bi ga res napadla, bi po njenem prepričanju Matić lahko preprosto odšel stran, tako pa ju je oba s kovinsko palico potolkel do smrti. Pravzaprav samo Angela, ki je umrl nekaj minut po napadu, medtem ko je njegova polsestra Milka umrla tri tedne kasneje v bolnišnici.
Tudi odvetnik hčerk umorjenih zakoncev Grbac Franci Matoz ne dvomi, da je Matić napad načrtoval in da si je izmislil, da sta ga umorjena napadla in mu grozila z orožjem.
Na drugi strani pa odvetnik Branko Gvozdić trdi, da njegovo dejanje ni bilo ne naklepno ne načrtovano, ampak da se je znašel v kočljivem položaju in v njem žal reagiral tako, kot je.
“Nobenega dvoma ni, da je obtoženi vzel življenje obema pokojnima. Temu ne oporeka nihče, niti on sam.” je poudaril Gvozdić.
Sodnik bo sodbo razglasil v ponedeljek popoldne.

Prosecution proposes 30 years in prison for Matic
07 Nov 2019, 15:17 by Danijel Cek

"He did the act out of pure self-interest, revenge and hatred of the deceased. That is why I propose that he be found guilty and sentenced to 25 years imprisonment for each murder, ie a 30-year sentence, ”Koper prosecutor Anja Strovs said a little over an hour and suggested to Judge Julian Glavina that he be charged with the double murder in Marko Markov last year. Matic is found guilty. Matić's lawyer, Branko Gvozdić, claims that it was not a planned murder, but rather a silo or a mishap.



Koper prosecutor Anja Strovs has suggested to Judge Julian Glavina to find Marko Matic guilty of the double murder in Krkavce last year and sentenced him to 30 years in prison. Photo: Zdravko Primozic / FPA

KOPER> The prosecutor claims that Matic's argument that his late half-sister Milka Grbac and her husband Angel were the first to attack him does not withstand serious judgment. And even if she did attack him, in her opinion, Matic could have simply gone away, shoving them both to death with a metal stick. In fact, it was only Angela who died minutes after the attack, while his half-sister Milka died three weeks later in hospital.
Even the lawyer of the daughters of the murdered spouses, Grbac Franci Matoz, does not doubt that Matic planned the attack and that he had made up his mind that the murdered men had attacked him and threatened him with a weapon.
On the other hand, lawyer Branko Gvozdić claims that his act was neither intentional nor planned, but that he found himself in a delicate position and unfortunately reacted in the way he did.
“There is no doubt that the accused took the life of both the deceased. No one disputes this, neither does he himself. ”Gvozdić emphasized.
The judge will deliver his judgment on Monday afternoon.
